metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3124 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The HVMOP_set_mem_type control in Xen 4.1 through 4.4.x allows local guestHVM administrators to cause a denial of service (hypervisor crash) orpossibly execute arbitrary code by leveraging a separate qemu-dmvulnerability to trigger invalid page table translations for unspecifiedmemory page types.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xen-utils-common - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
xenstore-utils - 4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-0ubuntu5.1').
